summary: This is a cover letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney Christian Everdell submitting a renewed bail motion reply memorandum and exhibits under seal to Judge Nathan in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The filing includes both redacted and unredacted versions of the reply memorandum and two exhibits.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) for which this bail motion reply is being filed.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP submitting the bail motion reply documents to Judge Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell to whom the bail motion reply is being submitted.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting legal documents (bail motion reply) on behalf of Maxwell as her defense attorney.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and will rule on her bail motion.

events.title: Renewed Bail Motion Reply Submission
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submits a renewed bail motion reply memorandum and exhibits under seal to Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a renewed bail motion reply in December 2020 while she was awaiting trial.
The documents were submitted under seal pursuant to a court order (Docket 89).
The filing includes both redacted and unredacted versions of the reply memorandum and two exhibits (A and B).
Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP represented Maxwell in this bail proceeding.
The case is U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AIN), presided over by Judge Nathan.
